_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: N.J.A.C 7:1E, Discharges of petroleum and Other Hazardous Substances

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

A.    Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



Rinchem Company, Inc. (Rinchem) is totally committed to safety and the implementation of safe procedures.  Its commitment is exemplified by its overall safety policy which states:



"No job is more important than the health and safety of our employees, our communities and the environment." 



This policy is supported by everyone at Rinchem, but first and foremost by senior management. 



B.    Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled



Rinchem's Flemington Chemical Warehouse at 55 River Road, Flemington, New Jersey, stores and distributes chemicals for the high tech, semiconductor, pharmaceutical and electronics industries. Hydrochloric acid (37%), aqueous ammonia (29%), hydrofluoric acid (50%), and titanium tetrachloride are the only substances at this facility that are regulated under New Jersey's Toxic Catastrophe Prevention Act (TCPA) regulations and are stored above the applicable threshold quantities. The chemicals are not involved with any processes at this location other than handling and storage of closed totes, drums and bottles, and insertion of specially controlled dip tubes in certain drums. No transfer of material from one container to another occurs at the facility.



The Rinchem's Flemington Chemical Warehouse is located in an industrial area with mixed agricultural and industrial areas. The facility was purchased by Rinchem and the inventory of materials stored on site was increased gradually from start of storage operations in 2008 until full storage operations were reached in 2009. After Rinchem purchased the property, Rinchem contracted to have the building modified as necessary to meet applicable fire codes, building codes and industry standards for warehouses that store hazardous materials. There are many features designed into the building that help to prevent a release to the environment of any of the stored substances, such as secondary contain

ment at the docks and fire protection systems.  The materials in the warehouse are segregated by hazard class according to the applicable federal and state regulations.



C.    General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



The three key elements of Rinchem's release prevention program are (1) compliance with federal and state regulations, (2) engineering controls, and (3) dedication to training and safety.

The areas of compliance include:



-     having a Hazardous Materials Management Plan

-     only accepting materials that are in Department of Transportation-approved containers

-     segregating materials according to their hazard class

-     limiting access to the facility

-     performance of daily inspections of the material handling equipment used in the facility



The facility is inspected daily to ensure that all operations are running safely and smoothly and to determine if any of the containers in storage are leaking.  It is Rinchem's policy that any time a release is detected, the supervisor is notified and it is cleaned up immediately by properly trained technicians:  Rinchem personnel if the release is small or outside contractors for all other releases.  Training is an essential element of Rinchem's prevention program since an informed and trained workforce can prevent most accidents.  The training includes classroom and on-the-job training for all new employees, as well as annual reviews of the operating procedures with the employees and supervisors who perform the tasks at the facility.



In addition, the Rinchem's Flemington Chemical Warehouse is updating and implementing a release prevention program in accordance with the New Jersey TCPA regulations for the storage of aqueous ammonia and hydrochloric acid.  The release prevention program consists of the following elements:



-    Process Safety Information

-    Process Hazard Analysis with Risk Assessment

-    Standard Operating Procedures

-    EHS Operator Training 

-    Me

chanical Integrity/Preventive Maintenance 

-    Management of Change 

-    Pre-Startup Review 

-    Compliance Audit 

-    EHS Accident or Potential Catastrophic Event Investigation 

-    Employee Participation 

-    Hot Work Permit 

-    Contractors

-    Emergency Response 

-    Annual Reports

-    Inherently Safer Technology Review



D.    Five-Year Accident History



The Rinchem Flemington facility has not had any accidental releases that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known off site deaths, injuries evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



E.    Emergency Response Program



Rinchem has a chemical exposure and spills procedure and a comprehensive business continuity plan.  The business continuity plan includes evacuation and notification procedures for the employees of Rinchem.  The facility is included in the written community emergency response plan.  Rinchem has made arrangements with an outside contractor for spill response.



F.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Rinchem's procedures, safety policies, facility design and many other preventive measures keep its employees, the community and the environment safe.  However, we are in the process of updating and implementing a risk management program in accordance with the New Jersey Toxic Catastrophe Prevention Act regulations.  Rinchem is also committed to working our corrective action process to monitor and improve the safety of all operations.
